gurmukhi: piRQm mMqR dXo ijnY soeI jwn kY gurdyv ]jog kwrx ko clw jIA jwn kY AnByv ]
transliteration: Pritham Mantra Dayo Jinai Soijaan Kai Gurdev|| Jog Kaaran Ko Dhaala Jeea Jaan Kai Anbhev||
translation: He, who in the first place gave this mantra, feeling about that Lord in his mind and accepting Him as the Guru, Dutt proceeded for getting instructions in Yoga;

gurmukhi: qwq mwq rhy mnY kir mwn bYn n eyk ]Gor kwnin kO clw Dir joig nXws Anyk ]113]
transliteration: Taat Maat Rahe Mania Kar(i) Maan Bain Na Ek|| Ghor Kaanaam(i) Kau Chalaa Dhar(i) Jog(i) Nyaas Anek||113||
translation: Though the parents dissuaded him, he did not accept the saying of anyone; he assumed the garb of a Yogi and went towards a dense forest.113.

gurmukhi: Gor kwnn mY krI qpsw Anyk pRkwr ]BwNq BwNqn ky kry iek ic`q mMqR aucwr ]
transliteration: Ghor Kaanam Mai Karitapsaa Anek Prakaar|| Bhaant Bhaantan Ke Dare Ik Chitt Mantra Ouchaar||
translation: In the forest, he performed austerities in many ways and concentrating his mind, he recited various kinds of mantras;

gurmukhi: kSt kY jb hI kIAw qp Gor brK pRmwn ]bu`iD ko bru dyq By qb Awn bu`iD inDwn ]114]
transliteration: Kasht Hai Jab Hikeea Tap Ghor Barakh Pramaan|| Buddh(i) Ko Bar(u) Det Bhe Tab Aan Buddh(i) Nidhaan||114||
translation: When he, enduring tribulations for many years, performed great austerities, then the Lord, the treasure of wisdom, gave him the boon of ‘wisdom’.114.

gurmukhi: bu`iD ko bru jwau dXo iqn Awn bu`iD AnMq ]prm purK pivqR kY gey d`q dyv mhMq ]
transliteration: Buddh(i) Ko Bar(u) Jaao Dayo Tin Aan Buddh(i) Anant|| Param Purakh Pavitra Kai Gad Datt Dev Mahant||
translation: When this boon was bestowed upon him, then infinite wisdom penetrated within him and that great Dutt, reached the abode of that supreme Purusha (Lord);

gurmukhi: Aks mwqR bFI qbY buiD jqR q`qR idswn ]Drm pRcur kIAw jhI qh prm pwp iKswn ]115]
transliteration: Aks Maatra Badhitabai Budh(i) Jatra Tattra Disaan|| Dharam Prachur Keeaa Jahitah Param Paap Khisaan||115
translation: This wisdom suddenly extended on various sides and he propagated Dharma, which destroyed the sins.115.

gurmukhi: piRQm Akwl gurU kIAw ijh ko kbY nhI nws ]jqR qqR idsw ivsw ijh Taur srb invws ]
transliteration: Pritham Akaal Guroo Keeaa Jih Ko Kabai Nahinaas|| Jatra Tatra Disaa Visaa Jih Thaur Sarab Nivaas||
translation: In this way, he adopted the eternal unmanifested Brahman as His first Guru, who pervades in all directions; He who has spread the four major divisions of creation viz.,

gurmukhi: AMf jyrj syq auqBuj kIn jws pswr ]qwih jwn gurU kIXo muin siq d`q suDwr ]116]
transliteration: And Jeraj St Outbhuj Keen Jaas Pasaar|| Tah(i) Jaan Guroo Keeyo Mounndi) Sat(i) Datt Sudhaar||116||
translation: Andaja (oviparous) Jeraj (viviparous), Svetaja (generated by heat and moisture) and Utbhija (germinating), the sage Dutt accepted that Lord as his first Guru.116.
End of the description about the adoption of the Unmanifested Brahman as the first Guru.
(Now begins the description of the second Guru)

gurmukhi: prm rUp pivqR mun jn jog krm inDwn ]dUsry gur kau krw mn eI mnY muin mwn ]
transliteration: Param Roop Pavitra Mounndjan Jog Karam Nidhaan|| Doosre Gur Kau Karaa Man Imania Mounndi) Maan||
translation: The sage Dutt, supremely immaculate and the ocean of Yoga, then meditated in his mind on the second Guru sand made the mind his guru;

gurmukhi: nwQ qau hI pCwn jo mn mwneI ijh kwl ]is`D qau mn kwmnw suD hoq hY suin lwl ]117]
transliteration: Naath Tau Hipachhaad Jo Man Maanaijih Kaal|| Siddh Tau Man Kaamnaa Sudh Hot Hai Soun(i) Laal||117||
translation: When the mind becomes stable, that supreme Lord is recognized and the heart’s desires are fulfilled.117.
